cache_key: review::Agentic AI architecture for mobile apps::sources=8::len=10572

issues: Declared source count is 8 but only 4 references are listed; mismatch and incomplete bibliography.
References are placeholders without bibliographic details (authors, titles, dates, links) and mainly support report structure rather than technical claims.

Many technical assertions (privacy redaction efficacy, hybrid inference decisioning, on‑device vector search feasibility, thermal/energy constraints) lack citations or empirical evidence despite the presence of a references section.
No explicit threat model or trust boundaries; missing treatment of prompt injection, jailbreaks, tool‑output sanitization, and compromised tool scenarios.
On‑device model strategy is underspecified: no candidate models, parameter counts, quantization schemes, memory/CPU/NPU targets, latency/accuracy trade‑offs, or provider comparison criteria.
Rollback semantics are vague for irreversible actions (e.g., messages sent); no idempotency, compensating actions, outbox/transaction patterns, or side‑effect scoping.
Security gaps: key management and secret storage (Keychain/Secure Enclave/Android Keystore), token refresh, encryption at rest/in transit, and code/package integrity are not specified.
Mobile OS constraints are not concretely addressed: iOS/Android background execution limits, task resumption, termination handling, thermal throttling policies, and scheduling/backoff strategies.
Tooling safety is high level; lacks concrete sandboxing/isolation model, permission scoping enforcement mechanics, and least‑privilege credential handling per tool.
Interface and schema evolution concerns are missing: versioning, backward compatibility, and cross‑platform serialization (Swift/Kotlin/Protobuf/JSON) details.
Observability may be insufficient for debugging if only tool names are logged; no plan for privacy‑preserving payload traces (e.g., redacted/hashing strategies) or tamper‑evident audit logs.
Data governance/compliance not covered: data retention/TTL, user data export/deletion (GDPR/CCPA/DSAR), consent management, and privacy manifests (iOS/Android).
Evaluation lacks concrete targets and baselines: no specific SLIs/SLOs (latency budgets, tool‑call caps per scenario, success rates), datasets, or benchmarking methodology.
Performance/cost sections lack quantified budgets (tokens/sec, cold/warm start times, memory/flash footprint, power draw) and workload modeling.
Safety filtering and content moderation approaches (toxicity/PII/NSFW) are not defined, nor are their on‑device feasibility and accuracy/latency trade‑offs.
No comparison to existing agent frameworks/tooling relevant to mobile (e.g., ReAct/Toolformer patterns, mobile agent SDKs); alternatives analysis is shallow.
State sync and multi‑device considerations (conflict resolution, merge/diff of context/memory) are not discussed.
No diagrams or trust‑boundary visuals to ground the architecture and data flows.
new_queries: iOS background execution and thermal throttling guidelines (BackgroundTasks, app life cycle) site:developer.apple.com
Android 14/15 background execution limits, WorkManager, foreground services, thermal throttling site:developer.android.com
On-device LLM benchmarks on A17 Pro and Snapdragon 8 Gen 3: tokens/sec, memory footprint, quantization (INT4/INT8, AWQ/GPTQ) comparative studies
On-device vector search on mobile (FAISS alternatives, SQLite+vec extensions, Milvus Lite) performance and storage footprint
Prompt injection and tool-use security best practices for agents (academic papers and industry guidance, 2023–2025)
Structured tool-calling reliability comparisons across LLM providers (function calling / JSON mode adherence, error rates)
PII redaction on-device: NER vs rule-based accuracy/latency trade-offs and privacy guarantees
Mobile key management: iOS Keychain/Secure Enclave and Android Keystore best practices for OAuth tokens and API keys
GDPR/CCPA compliance for mobile telemetry: consent, data retention, DSAR handling; Apple Privacy Manifest and Android Data safety form
Compensating transactions and undo patterns for mobile side-effects (outbox pattern, idempotency keys, dry-run/preview flows)
Energy modeling and measurement for on-device ML inference (Instruments Energy Log, Android Battery Historian) and mitigation techniques
Sandboxing and permission scoping for in-app tools (process isolation, IPC, least-privilege credential scoping)
Schema versioning strategies for tool interfaces and cross-platform serialization (Protobuf vs JSON with JSON Schema) on mobile
Privacy-preserving observability: redaction pipelines, deterministic hashing, and tamper-evident audit logging on device
Safety filtering pipelines on-device (toxicity/PII/NSFW) model options, latency, and effectiveness trade-offs
State persistence and resumable agent execution under app termination (checkpointing, journaling) on iOS/Android
Hybrid inference decisioning policies: when to elevate to cloud (risk/latency/cost models) with empirical thresholds
